data.quote: There’s no shortcuts to any place worth going.
data.author: Clare Smyth

data.quote: Recipes don’t work unless you use your heart!
data.author: Dylan Jones

data.quote: Today’s innovation is tomorrow’s tradition..
data.author: Lidia Bastianich

data.quote: The duty of a good cuisinier is to transmit to the next generation everything he has learned and experienced.
data.author: Fernand Point

data.quote: Although the skills aren't hard to learn, finding the happiness and finding the satisfaction and finding fulfillment in continuously serving somebody else something good to eat, is what makes a really good restaurant.
data.author: Mario Batali

data.quote: I think all chefs who pursue great flavor have good ethics.
data.author: Dan Barber

data.quote: The discovery of a new dish does more for the happiness of mankind than the discovery of a star.
data.author: Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

data.quote: As chefs, we cook to please people, to nourish people.
data.author: Jose Andres

data.quote: To me, there's no great chef without a great team.
data.author: Daniel Boulud

data.quote: A good cook is like a sorceress who dispenses happiness.
data.author: Elsa Schiaparelli

data.quote: Being involved, learning firsthand and observing the craft and absorbing all you can, makes it easier to define what you want. It will also ultimately make you a better Chef. Culinary school, or even a single class, is a great bet too.
data.author: Giada De Laurentiis

data.quote: I think the most wonderful thing in the world is another chef. I'm always excited about learning new things about food.
data.author: Paul Prudhomme

data.quote: No one is born a great cook, one learns by doing.
data.author: Julia Child

data.quote: Techniques are not the most difficult to teach. The attitudes chefs take are much more important.
data.author: Alain Ducasse

data.quote: Every week I want to learn something new. And every week I want to teach someone something new.
data.author: Chef Edward Lee

data.quote: Techniques are not the most difficult to teach. The attitudes chefs take are much more important.
data.author: Alain Ducasse

data.quote: We're hoping to succeed; we're okay with failure. We just don't want to land in between.
data.author: David Chang

data.quote: We go through our careers and things happen to us. Those experiences made me what I am.
data.author: Thomas Keller

data.quote: My philosophy from day one is that I can sleep better at night if I can improve an individual’s knowledge about food and wine, and do it on a daily basis.
data.author: Emeril Lagasse

data.quote: A great restaurant doesn't distinguish itself by how few mistakes it makes but by how well they handle those mistakes.
data.author: Danny Meyer

data.quote: You don't go to school to become the best chef in the world right after you graduate. School is always a starting point so what people forget is that you go to school to build a foundation, and you want to build a foundation that's not going to crumble.
data.author: Roy Yamaguchi

data.quote: I've been a cook all my life, but I am still learning to be a good chef. I'm always learning new techniques and improving beyond my own knowledge because there is always something new to learn and new horizons to discover.
data.author: Jose Andrés
